helperbird.question: What is Helperbird?
helperbird.answer: Helperbird is a browser extension that makes websites, PDFs, and documents easier to read. It includes text-to-speech, dyslexia-friendly fonts, reading guides, and many other tools to help you read and write online.

helperbird.question: How do I install Helperbird?
helperbird.answer: Visit your browser's extension store (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Safari), search for 'Helperbird', and click 'Add to Browser'. Once installed, you'll see the Helperbird icon in your toolbar.

helperbird.question: Is Helperbird free?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird has a free version with essential features that will always be free. We also offer Helperbird Pro with advanced tools for $6.99/month or $29.99/year.

helperbird.question: How do I log in to Helperbird?
helperbird.answer: Click the Helperbird icon, go to Settings, and log in using your browser's email account. If you have a subscription key, you can enter it there too.

helperbird.question: Can Helperbird read text out loud?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Select any text on a page, right-click, and choose 'Text to speech' from the Helperbird menu. You can also use the play button in the Helperbird panel.

helperbird.question: Does Helperbird work with PDFs?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Open any PDF in your browser and Helperbird's tools will work on it, including text-to-speech, fonts, overlays, and Immersive Reader.

helperbird.question: Does Helperbird work with Google Docs?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Install the Helperbird add-on for Google Docs & Slides from the Google Workspace Marketplace to use features like text-to-speech and Immersive Reader.

helperbird.question: Can Helperbird help with dyslexia?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird includes dyslexia-friendly fonts like OpenDyslexic and Lexend, a dyslexia ruler, color overlays, and text-to-speech to make reading easier.

helperbird.question: What is Immersive Reader?
helperbird.answer: Immersive Reader is a Microsoft tool built into Helperbird. It reads text aloud, breaks words into syllables, highlights parts of speech, and translates content. Select text and right-click to use it.

helperbird.question: How do I change the font on websites?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, go to the Text settings section, and choose from 15+ fonts including OpenDyslexic, Lexend, Arial, and more.

helperbird.question: How do I use the color overlay?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, find 'Color overlay' in the Dyslexia support section, toggle it on, and pick a color. This helps reduce visual stress while reading.

helperbird.question: How do I use the dyslexia ruler?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, find 'Dyslexia ruler' in the Dyslexia support section, and toggle it on. You can adjust its height, color, and whether it follows your cursor.

helperbird.question: Can I translate web pages?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird can translate any webpage into 100+ languages using Google Translate. Find 'Translate page' in the Helperbird menu.

helperbird.question: How do I customize Quick Actions?
helperbird.answer: Click 'Customize Quick Actions' at the top of the Helperbird panel to add or remove your most-used features from the quick access area.

helperbird.question: Can I use Helperbird on multiple devices?
helperbird.answer: Yes! With Helperbird Pro, your settings sync across all devices where you're signed into the same browser account.

helperbird.question: Does Helperbird work offline?
helperbird.answer: Most features work offline, including fonts, colors, overlays, and the reading guide. Text-to-speech works offline with your browser's built-in voices.

helperbird.question: Does Helperbird collect my data?
helperbird.answer: No. Helperbird stores your settings locally in your browser. We don't collect, store, or sell any personal data.

helperbird.question: How do I cancel my subscription?
helperbird.answer: You can cancel anytime with no penalties. Go to the Account section in Helperbird settings and click 'Manage subscription', or email support@helperbird.com.

helperbird.question: Can I get a refund?
helperbird.answer: Yes! If you're not satisfied, contact us within 30 days of purchase at support@helperbird.com for a full refund.

helperbird.question: Do you offer student discounts?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Students get a discount on Helperbird Pro. No student email required - just let us know you're a student when you sign up.

helperbird.question: Do you accept purchase orders?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Schools and organizations can pay by purchase order. Email sales@helperbird.com to get started.

helperbird.question: How do I reset Helperbird settings?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, go to Settings, scroll to 'Data & Storage', and click 'Reset all data'. This restores all settings to default.

helperbird.question: How do I contact support?
helperbird.answer: Email us at support@helperbird.com or use the Help section in Helperbird. We typically respond within 24 hours.

helperbird.question: Can I suggest new features?
helperbird.answer: Yes! We love hearing your ideas. Email suggestions to robert.gabriel@helperbird.com or use our feedback form on the website.

helperbird.question: Is Helperbird available for schools?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird Unlimited is designed for schools and organizations. It includes admin controls, volume licensing, and deployment options. Visit helperbird.com/pricing for details.

helperbird.question: How do I use voice typing?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, find 'Voice typing' in the Writing section, and click to start. Speak clearly and your words will appear as text. Works in most text fields.

helperbird.question: What is Reading Mode?
helperbird.answer: Reading Mode removes ads, sidebars, and clutter from web pages, leaving just the main content. You can customize fonts, colors, and spacing for a distraction-free reading experience.

helperbird.question: How do I take a screenshot?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird and click 'Screenshot' in the tools section. You can capture the visible area or select a specific region of the page.

helperbird.question: Can Helperbird extract text from images?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Use the 'Extract text (OCR)' feature to copy text from images, screenshots, or scanned documents. Just draw a box around the text you want to extract.

helperbird.question: How do I use keyboard shortcuts?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, go to Settings, and click 'Keyboard shortcuts' to see and customize shortcuts for your favorite features.

helperbird.question: Does Helperbird work on iPhone or iPad?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird is available for Safari on iPhone and iPad. Download it from the App Store and enable it in Safari settings.

helperbird.question: Why isn't Helperbird working on a website?
helperbird.answer: Some websites block extensions for security reasons, like banking sites or browser system pages. Try refreshing the page or check if the site has restrictions.

helperbird.question: Can I use Helperbird on YouTube?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird works on YouTube. You can use features like color overlays, dyslexia ruler, and even adjust the video playback speed.

helperbird.question: What's the difference between Free and Pro?
helperbird.answer: Free includes essential tools like basic fonts, color overlays, and the reading guide. Pro unlocks advanced features like Immersive Reader, natural text-to-speech voices, OCR, and syncing across devices.

helperbird.question: Can I try Helperbird Pro before buying?
helperbird.answer: Yes! We offer a free 3-day trial of Helperbird Pro. Click 'Try Pro free' in the Helperbird panel to start.

helperbird.question: How do I change the text-to-speech voice?
helperbird.answer: Open Helperbird, go to the Text to speech section, and click on the voice dropdown to choose from available voices. Pro users get access to natural-sounding voices.

helperbird.question: Can I highlight text and save it?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Use the Highlighter feature to mark text in different colors. Your highlights are saved and you can export them as notes.

helperbird.question: Does Helperbird work with Microsoft Word online?
helperbird.answer: Yes! Helperbird works with Word Online in your browser. Open your document in the browser and Helperbird's features will be available.

helperbird.question: How do I turn off Helperbird on a specific website?
helperbird.answer: Click the Helperbird icon and toggle it off using the switch at the top. Your settings will be remembered for that site.
